newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold falls, volume surges on arbitrage.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold falls, volume surges on arbitrage.

text.p: Volume on the Istanbul gold exchange more than doubled to 2,076 kilos on Monday from Friday's 980 kilos due to heavy arbitrage trading by banks, dealers said.
Gold fell to $335.00 an ounce and 1,599,300 lira per gram from Friday's $338.00 and 1,603,000 on lower world levels.
"Only about 600 to 700 kilos of the total trade was to meet demand from the free (gold) market while the rest was arbitrage deals by banks," said one banker.
"Normally, demand would pick up at such lower price levels, but almost everyone expects gold's trend to be downward in the medium-term," he added.
The Turkish currency closed weaker at 148,360 against the dollar versus 147,400 on Friday, cushioning the fall in lira prices and thus encouraging arbitrage.
Most of the day's trade -- 1,406 kilos -- took place in the morning session and 57.8 percent of the total volume was in lira. --Istanbul newsroom +90-212-2750875
